Key Match Events: Jarrett Allen’s layup off a screen, with the Bucks double-teaming Darius Garland, gave the hosts a 115-111 lead with 14.1 seconds remaining.
Allen sealed the win by blocking Lillard at the rim.
Post-Match Reflections: Doc Rivers said, 'We were supposed to switch and we just didn’t. Those are the things that just kill you. You play so hard, man and then you make these little self-inflicted wounds.'
Doc Rivers added, 'We had so many chances to win the game. Last two games, we've had chances to win the game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee's defensive shortcomings ultimately cost them their sixth straight loss.
Darius Garland torched them for 12 of his 39 points in the final 6:06 in the game.
